metadata.description:
I started working on a project called OG Cool (Only Good Comes Out Of Living) in the fall of 2013 with one of my best friends, super-producer, Nash B. During that period of time we recorded 30-40 songs towards what I thought would be the final album. The summer of the following year I lost the only hard-drive that had every session file/track-out and bounce for my entire catalog of unreleased music (1200+ songs/production/demos) to that point, (OG Cool included). A few years ago I began to recover some of the music from that hard-drive (Thank God for clouds and email accounts lol) One of my favorites from those album sessions (and closest to me) is a song called "Brothers Talk".

Growing up in the states as a child to an immigrant family, I grew used to not having a lot of blood-related family around me. It was always just me and my little brothers. This upbringing conditioned me to value the people closest to me as family and not just friends.
"Brothers Talk" was a chance for me to hold a conversation with two close friends (that have always been brothers to me) during their times of need. One friend lost a father and the other lost his way.
I originally intended on placing this on the album but for now this is a just a marker for major moments in time. This is the last bounce I did after I originally recorded the record at my home studio.

Much love to the good homie, Myles Stefan for the amazing guitar solo at the end and my lil bro Nash B for supporting me getting back to my production (I made this beat). This song is in honor of my blood brothers Chris and Thorence (Long Live Baby Thor). I consider the people who care enough to listen to and support my music my family. As I work on my album (among a million projects lol) and we continue to build up this VibeHaus family, I wanted to offer this song as an invitation to join the Tribe. 

This is me, no final mix, just soul & love. I appreciate you for walking on this journey with me. The way is just a little bit longer but we're almost there.


Engineered By Scolla Fungwe
Produced By Scolla Fungwe
Artwork By Scolla Fungwe
Guitar Solo By Myles Stefan
Bassline By Nash B

lyrics.text:
Verse 1:
Look
I had a talk with one of my brothers the other day/
He told me truthfully speaking bro I believe in you/
Ever since youngins your message has been the same/
No matter what believe that success will be there for me and you/
Word is bond
I made a promise to his papa before he passed/
That I've got his son forever, I got his back (he never knew)/ 
So let it be so/
But whenever we blow/
Whatever's mine is his/
Just add it up divide the shit and yeah you got it/
From ye high we shared each other's mothers/
You're the baby of your fam but big bro to my little brothers/
and for that I love you/
Like a penny we'll never change/
and the loyalty's running thicker than anything in my veins/
I swear, you're my negu/
Remember when we had few teeth now we fly negus/
You ride and I'll ride with ya/
If it's all on the line then I'm ready to die with ya/
When ya pops died he was like mine so I cried with ya/ (Know that)
I bare that pain and share that load/
And love's a forever thing no matter where life goes/ 
Keep in Mind/
As we play the children of father time/
The cost of loyalty's paid, forever Im by your side/ 
I promise

Chorus:
When we were kids I knew we'd be friends forever/
And every night I prayed that these times will never end/ (noooo)
But life goes/ (Goes On)
Even so this bond we share will never change/
Just get better/

Verse 2:
I had a talk with one of my brothers the other day/
I told him truthfully speaking bro I believe in you/
Ever since youngins my message has been the same/
No matter what I know that success is out there for me and you/
Just gotta reach for it/
I ain't trying to preach bro but/
There ain't no way to pick the fruit if ain't no tree growing/
So don't mistaken I ain't saying you ain't capable/
But to create a movement the emphasis is on make a move/
I know that you've got it in you to be the illest/
Shit you're my negu, I only rock with the realest/
Mind body and spirit/
Give it all to get it all/
Know that if you make the jump that I'll pick you up from the fall/
My dawg, since ye high/
Remember when we both wanted Brandi the same time/
Them was some of the days huh?/
Doing wrong and the right shit/
Juggling all the life shit/
Was cool kids but man we was all trying to be Mike Mitch/ (Ha)
And now we both grown men/
Time to shine with all the jewels that we ain't know then/ (My brother's keeper)
Just know what's yours is my issue/
When DLo died and you cried, I cried with you/
So know, I bare that pain and share that load/
And love's a forever thing no matter where life goes/ 
Keep in Mind/
As we play the children of father time/
The cost of loyalty's paid, forever Im by your side/ 
I promise

Chorus

Outro:
Brother, Sister
Sister, Brother Yeah
Brother, Sister
Sister, Brother Yeah
Brother, Sister
Sister, Brother Yeah
One Love
One Love

metadata.name: Brothers Talk Demo #1
metadata.title: Brothers Talk Demo
